summary: I'm sure you got a lot on your hands but if you'd like, could you maybe make the dumbass trio prompt into a small one shot or...
question: I'm sure you got a lot on your hands but if you'd like, could you maybe make the dumbass trio prompt into a small one shot or something please? it's so pure omg
answer:
Honey

– a dumbass trio fic

“Is honey a fruit or a vegetable?”

TJ his pause on Fortnite so both he and Jonah can put down their remotes and turn to look at Marty. He’s rolled on to his stomach, lounging on the floor behind them in a lazy sprawl, picking at the hood of his sleeping bag. TJ is less surprised about the ridiculous question and more so that Marty is awake - he thought he’d fallen asleep quite a while ago. It wouldn’t be unusual - it’s almost two in the morning and he always crashes first. Some boys just can’t take their sugar.

“Dude,” Jonah says with an appalled look on his face. “Neither. It’s a liquid.”

“Yeah but if you liquidise tomato it still counts as a fruit,” Marty replies.  “Besides, ‘liquid’ isn’t a food group.”

“Yeah but there are more than two food groups, Marts,” TJ chimes in. “Obviously it’s not a fruit or vegetable.”

“Well, why not?”

“Because… fruits have to have seeds in and vegetables… vegetables…”

“So it’s a vegetable?”

“No!”

“Wait, hold on,” Says Jonah. “Aren’t fruits and vegetables in the same food group anyway?”

A thoughtful silence falls across the room.

“…Maybe it’s a dairy product?” TJ suggests.

Marty makes a noise of outrage. “There’s no way it’s dairy - there isn’t milk in it!”

“Yeah but it comes from bees, right? And products that come from animals are either dairy or meat. It can’t be meat.”

“Why not?”

“Because it’s solid, Marty!”

The Xbox controllers lay forgotten at TJ and Jonah’s feet as they fall into their usual pattern of bickering back and forth rather sounding rather nonsensical after a while. Amused, Jonah picks up his phone. It occurs to him for a brief moment that he could do a quick Google search and end this discussion point blank, but that would be less fun. Instead, he flips open Snapchat and starts recording.

Ten minutes later, TJ’s phone rings. He frowns at the lit up screen and picks it up careful to answer. “Cy? What are you doing up?”

The phone does not need to be put on speaker for the other two to hear Cyrus’ loud yet resigned “Honey is a sugar, you morons” before the line goes dead.

summary: sorry if you've already answered this before, but what email would we use to get ahold of disney to tell them why we want am to...
question: sorry if you've already answered this before, but what email would we use to get ahold of disney to tell them why we want am to be renewed?
answer:
gary.marsh@disney.com (Gary Marsh, President and Chief Creative Officer)

chrissy.woo@disney.com (Chrissy Woo, Media Relations for Andi Mack)

julie.m.mitchell@disney.com (Julie Mitchell, Media Relations for Andi Mack)

You can find other Disney Channel employee contact information on the PR website here: https://www.wdtvpress.com/disneychannel/contacts/ 

Most Disney Channel executive/employee email addresses are just firstname.lastname@disney.com so if there’s anyone else you want to contact specifically and you can’t find their email address online, you can always just try to fill in the blank! 

Please remain professional in your emails. No cursing, no spamming, no memes. Take it seriously and present them with your reasoning for wanting Andi Mack to be renewed. If you send emails to multiple employees, consider addressing them to “To Whom It May Concern,” instead of one specific person so that they can pass it along to higher ups if necessary.

summary: so what can we actually do to help you with the paper crane project at this point?
question: so what can we actually do to help you with the paper crane project at this point?
answer:
at this point i have enough messages and donations to complete and ship the initial 1,000 paper cranes. however, i am not closing the submissions or donations page because if i get enough responses, i will make another set of cranes and send those as well. even if i don’t get enough response to send off a second set of 1,000 i will either send off a smaller set of cranes, or come up with another project idea using the remaining messages & money! updates to come on that after i get the first 1,000 shipped which should be within the next two weeks! so if you haven’t submitted a message or you want to donate - you can still do that!

beyond that: FOLD YOUR OWN CRANES AND POST PICTURES OF THEM!! Write letters and emails to Disney Channel about why you want Andi Mack renewed!!! Include #RenewAndiMack and @DisneyChannel & @DisneyChannelPR on your posts! Share MY posts on Instagram about the project and tag Disney Channel in them. Keep trying to get the cast involved as it brings more attention to the project as a whole. Follow @andimackpapercraneproject on instagram to keep up with everyone’s messages, etc!!

blog.name: tj-meets-cyrus
blog.title: Andi Mack
blog.description: Laura ☆ 22 ☆ side blog ☆ icon by @admirablyamber ☆ main: mystery-hack

summary: Lately i'm thinking about TJ and i'm so sad, because he seems so lonely and probably doesn't have any support in life, nobody to...
question: Lately i'm thinking about TJ and i'm so sad, because he seems so lonely and probably doesn't have any support in life, nobody to talk about situation with Kira, that he was scared about being outed and still that show makes him look like bad guy and have to apologize for things that aren't his fault and it hurts me a lot of more than it should
answer:
It hurts me too anon. I feel like TJ and Jonah are tied for Character On Andi Mack Who Cannot Seem to Catch A Break™

I agree, TJ doesn’t seem to have much of a support system. Sure, he’s on good terms with Buffy and Jonah now. And he definitely has quite a few basketball friends. But when he told Cyrus “you’re the only person I can talk to like this” you can tell he really meant it. 

I imagine the next episode with TJ to be very similar to The New Girls, with TJ sulking and sitting alone at lunch. Except this time, TJ will be actively avoiding Cyrus, instead of blowing up his phone like last time he had to apologize. In fact, I wouldn’t be surprised if Cyrus is the one to confront TJ about what happened. 

Which means emotionally closed-off TJ Kippen will have to be vulnerable in front of Cyrus Goodman, the only person he used to be able to talk to, but can’t anymore because he lost his trust. It’s going to make apologizing all the more difficult.

It’s going to make the inevitable coming out scene difficult as well. When Cyrus came out to Andi and Jonah, he had friends there to support him. Even when he came out to Buffy, he was coming out on his own terms with someone he felt comfortable with. TJ, on the other hand, will have to come out to someone who’s mad at him because he has to, not because he wants to. And he’s going to have to do it all by himself. 

I guess the one thing we should all keep in mind is that TJ and Cyrus are going to end up on good terms. The costume day situation is just a bump in the road, but I have faith in the writers that it’ll be worth it in the end.

It’s going to make the inevitable coming out scene difficult as well. When Cyrus came out to Andi and Jonah, he had friends there to support him. Even when he came out to Buffy, he was coming out on his own terms with someone he felt comfortable with. TJ, on the other hand, will have to come out to someone who’s mad at him because he has to, not because he wants to. And he’s going to have to do it all by himself. 

I guess the one thing we should all keep in mind is that TJ and Cyrus are going to end up on good terms. The costume day situation is just a bump in the road, but I have faith in the writers that it’ll be worth it in the end.

It hurts me too anon. I feel like TJ and Jonah are tied for Character On Andi Mack Who Cannot Seem to Catch A Break™

I agree, TJ doesn’t seem to have much of a support system. Sure, he’s on good terms with Buffy and Jonah now. And he definitely has quite a few basketball friends. But when he told Cyrus “you’re the only person I can talk to like this” you can tell he really meant it. 

I imagine the next episode with TJ to be very similar to The New Girls, with TJ sulking and sitting alone at lunch. Except this time, TJ will be actively avoiding Cyrus, instead of blowing up his phone like last time he had to apologize. In fact, I wouldn’t be surprised if Cyrus is the one to confront TJ about what happened.

body:
IMAGINE

If TJ rapped his apology to Cyrus😫 I was thinking about it and I decided to write one myself, so if you’re reading this Terri I think you should put it into consideration😁😉🤠👊👊

“I’m sorry that I ditched you

I know that wasn’t very cool

And it wasn’t because of you

No it was Kira acting like a fool

She knew one of my secrets

I was scared to be revealed

But now that you are hurt

I gotta do something to heal

There’s something that I gotta say

And I’m still afraid to tell you

But I think I found a way

I didn’t want to ditch you but

She knew that I was gay”

summary: I loved all your platonic tandi fics/hcs. I think a fic based on this line, "and she’ll be the first to admit that Bowie’s...
question: I loved all your platonic tandi fics/hcs. I think a fic based on this line, "and she’ll be the first to admit that Bowie’s explosion the first time he’d found TJ crashed out on Andi’s bed after having snuck in during the night was hilarious" would be hilarious
answer:
Thank you! Platonic Tandi is life and your wish is my command. And you can find the post that quote originates from here.

A Place To Stay

– A Platonic! Tandi fic

By the time he’s sixteen, the fighting that goes on between TJ’s parents has become so unbearable he’s taken to slipping out the front door and sleeping on benches in the park several nights a week. He doesn’t mean for anybody to find out about this, mostly because he feels too embarrassed to admit the way his mom and dad scream at one another scares him a little, but he’s beginning to realise that only death could stop Andi from sniffing out trouble when she’s worried about her friends. She waits on his doorstep one night, catching him sneaking out around midnight, and less than half an hour later he finds himself sat in the cracking plastic booth of a local twenty-four-hour cafe sipping terrible coffee and spilling everything to her.

After that, he doesn’t have to sleep on benches anymore. When he hears raised voices and the tell-tale slam of the kitchen door, he’ll hightail it out of there and head straight for the Macks’ house. Climbing in Andi’s window becomes a habit, one that Bex and Bowie don’t know a thing about, and it becomes one of those teenage secrets that are so carefully kept that it’s inevitable it will come crashing down around their ears.

And it does.

It’s the morning after one particularly bad night, the screaming had become crying and TJ had had to hold back his own tears as he crept out of his house. Andi’s bed is a comfortable cocoon of blankets and limbs, the two of them wrapped around one another having fallen asleep in a comforting embrace, and the sun shines too-bright across their faces through the gap in the curtain. It’s not the sun that wakes them though. It’s Bowie’s yell of “WHAT THE FUCK?” that has them both bolting upright in confusion, eyes still bleary with sleep.

“Oh my God,” Andi says, going from half asleep to wide-awake and alert when she sees the look of rage on his face. “Dad-”

“Why the hell are you in my daughter’s bed?!”

Now, Bowie Quinn is not a violent man. He never has been and he never will be. But at that moment Bowie Quinn was no longer Bowie Quinn - he was Andi Mack’s Father and Andi Mack’s Father was more than happy to lunge at TJ. Therefore, it is fortunate that TJ is a relatively limber young man and thus has no troubling ducking out of the way and rolling off the bed. It is not an especially graceful motion but it gets the job done and he is half-way across the room well out of Bowie’s reach in a heartbeat.

“Dad, calm down!” Andi yells, struggling out of the burrito that has become of her comforter. “He’s not-”

“Don’t tell me to calm down! There’s a boy in your bed! A boy! In your bed!”

It’s not a very smart move for TJ to butt in when he does, but teenage boys are never ones for common sense and all his survival instincts appeared to have deserted him right then. “Well, I’m not in her bed any more,” he points out, then immediately wishes he hadn’t.

Bowie turns on him looking a little less like he’s about to wring TJ’s neck as he did before but still not exactly the definition of welcoming.

“What’s going on in here?” Bex appears in the doorway, still clutching an open box of Captain Crunch, her brow furrowed in confusion. “What’s all the shouting?”

Bowie gestures wildly at TJ and splutters in a somewhat incoherent manner, “Boy! Bed! Boy! There’s a boy!”

Bex looks over at TJ, eyes widening in surprise, and takes in his ruffled appearance. He’s dressed in his own t-shirt and what appears to be a pair of Bowie’s old sweatpants - there are still red lines from where the creases of Andi’s pillow pressed into his face while he slept. It dawns on Bex all of a sudden that this is where Bowie’s lost old clothes have been going, and probably why the spare toothbrush went missing from the bathroom last month, and even more likely the reason they’ve had to go grocery shopping so much more than usual recently.

“TJ,” she greets, nodding to him. Then she turns to her daughter, who has now managed to escape her blanket prison and slide herself carefully into the space between Bowie and TJ, perhaps in an attempt to prevent any early-morning murders. “Andi, why is TJ in your bedroom at seven thirty in the morning?”

There’s a long pause and they all watch the cogs turn in Andi’s brain as she scrambles to think of a good cover story. “…He came over to study?”

Bex sighs. “I thought I taught you to like better than that. C’mon now, what’s the truth? Have you been here all night, TJ?”

“He was in her bed!” Bowie reiterates, seething. “Her bed, Bex! Teenagers! Bed!”

“Nothing happened!” Andi says, horror dawning on her face. “We were just sleeping!”

“Yes, but why wasn’t TJ sleeping in his own bed? At his house… you know, that place where he lives?” Bex asks.

The two teenagers glance at one another and Andi bites her lip. For one terrifying moment Bex is afraid they’re about to tell her that TJ has been kicked out. She doesn’t know what she’ll do if that’s the case.

“It’s my fault,” TJ says. “My parents have been fighting… I needed a place to crash. Andi was just being a good friend.”

Both Bex and Bowie soften at that.

“Why didn’t you just tell us that?” Bowie asks, the anger draining away fast.

“You don’t let me have sleepovers on weekdays,” Andi says, her tone implying a strong ‘duh’.

“Well yeah, but this is a little bit different,” Bex says. “If you’d told us we could’ve like… set up the couch or something. Made sure TJ had dinner and stuff. How long has this been going on?”

Andi and TJ give non-committal shrugs and Bex knows she’s not going to get a straight answer on that. Bowie steps in, his regular personality rejoining the party in place of Andi Mack’s Father.

“TJ, do your parents know you’re here?”

He shakes his head.

“Oh man, they could be freaking out right now. You can’t just sneak out without telling them, what if you got hurt or went missing or something-”

“They don’t notice.”

“What?”

“They don’t notice I’m gone. They never do.”

“Oh.” Bowie looks at Bex, quite unsure what to do. They seem almost to have a conversation with their eyes that TJ cannot quite understand, and they both turn back to look at him. “Okay, well… we can talk about this later. You guys need to get ready for school. I’ll drive you.”

“You guys want some breakfast?” Bex asks, turning back to head into the kitchen. “I can try and make pancakes again.”

Andi groans loudly, normality seeping back into the house at once and trails after Bex. “Oh, please don’t. I don’t want to have to call the fire department again…”

Relief washes over TJ. He had worried for a moment that he was either about to meet his death or get banned from the Macks’ house forever. He isn’t sure what he’d do if he couldn’t go to Andi - he doesn’t want to go back to sleeping on a bench. Bowie steps over to him and he tries not to flinch as the man lays a gentle hand on his shoulder.

“I’m sorry I yelled,” he says, looking TJ directly in the eye. “It just took me by surprise is all… from now on just let us know when you’re coming over, yeah? You’re always welcome here, but we have to know you’re here.”

TJ nods and knows he’ll do as he’s told without question. “I promise.”

“Good man,” Bowie ruffles his hair and heads out towards the kitchen, leaving a stunned TJ in his wake.

Bex doesn’t quite burn down the kitchen with her pancakes, and they get TJ his own inflatable mattress to sleep on after that.

It’s the morning after one particularly bad night, the screaming had become crying and TJ had had to hold back his own tears as he crept out of his house. Andi’s bed is a comfortable cocoon of blankets and limbs, the two of them wrapped around one another having fallen asleep in a comforting embrace, and the sun shines too-bright across their faces through the gap in the curtain. It’s not the sun that wakes them though. It’s Bowie’s yell of “WHAT THE FUCK?” that has them both bolting upright in confusion, eyes still bleary with sleep.

“Oh my God,” Andi says, going from half asleep to wide-awake and alert when she sees the look of rage on his face. “Dad-”

“Why the hell are you in my daughter’s bed?!”

Now, Bowie Quinn is not a violent man. He never has been and he never will be. But at that moment Bowie Quinn was no longer Bowie Quinn - he was Andi Mack’s Father and Andi Mack’s Father was more than happy to lunge at TJ. Therefore, it is fortunate that TJ is a relatively limber young man and thus has no troubling ducking out of the way and rolling off the bed. It is not an especially graceful motion but it gets the job done and he is half-way across the room well out of Bowie’s reach in a heartbeat.

“Dad, calm down!” Andi yells, struggling out of the burrito that has become of her comforter. “He’s not-”

“Don’t tell me to calm down! There’s a boy in your bed! A boy! In your bed!”

It’s not a very smart move for TJ to butt in when he does, but teenage boys are never ones for common sense and all his survival instincts appeared to have deserted him right then. “Well, I’m not in her bed any more,” he points out, then immediately wishes he hadn’t.

Bowie turns on him looking a little less like he’s about to wring TJ’s neck as he did before but still not exactly the definition of welcoming.

“What’s going on in here?” Bex appears in the doorway, still clutching an open box of Captain Crunch, her brow furrowed in confusion. “What’s all the shouting?”

Bowie gestures wildly at TJ and splutters in a somewhat incoherent manner, “Boy! Bed! Boy! There’s a boy!”

Bex looks over at TJ, eyes widening in surprise, and takes in his ruffled appearance. He’s dressed in his own t-shirt and what appears to be a pair of Bowie’s old sweatpants - there are still red lines from where the creases of Andi’s pillow pressed into his face while he slept. It dawns on Bex all of a sudden that this is where Bowie’s lost old clothes have been going, and probably why the spare toothbrush went missing from the bathroom last month, and even more likely the reason they’ve had to go grocery shopping so much more than usual recently.

“TJ,” she greets, nodding to him. Then she turns to her daughter, who has now managed to escape her blanket prison and slide herself carefully into the space between Bowie and TJ, perhaps in an attempt to prevent any early-morning murders. “Andi, why is TJ in your bedroom at seven thirty in the morning?”

There’s a long pause and they all watch the cogs turn in Andi’s brain as she scrambles to think of a good cover story. “…He came over to study?”

Bex sighs. “I thought I taught you to like better than that. C’mon now, what’s the truth? Have you been here all night, TJ?”

“He was in her bed!” Bowie reiterates, seething. “Her bed, Bex! Teenagers! Bed!”

“Nothing happened!” Andi says, horror dawning on her face. “We were just sleeping!”

“Yes, but why wasn’t TJ sleeping in his own bed? At his house… you know, that place where he lives?” Bex asks.

The two teenagers glance at one another and Andi bites her lip. For one terrifying moment Bex is afraid they’re about to tell her that TJ has been kicked out. She doesn’t know what she’ll do if that’s the case.

“It’s my fault,” TJ says. “My parents have been fighting… I needed a place to crash. Andi was just being a good friend.”

Both Bex and Bowie soften at that.

“Why didn’t you just tell us that?” Bowie asks, the anger draining away fast.

“You don’t let me have sleepovers on weekdays,” Andi says, her tone implying a strong ‘duh’.

“Well yeah, but this is a little bit different,” Bex says. “If you’d told us we could’ve like… set up the couch or something. Made sure TJ had dinner and stuff. How long has this been going on?”

Andi and TJ give non-committal shrugs and Bex knows she’s not going to get a straight answer on that. Bowie steps in, his regular personality rejoining the party in place of Andi Mack’s Father.

“TJ, do your parents know you’re here?”

He shakes his head.

“Oh man, they could be freaking out right now. You can’t just sneak out without telling them, what if you got hurt or went missing or something-”

“They don’t notice.”

“What?”

“They don’t notice I’m gone. They never do.”

“Oh.” Bowie looks at Bex, quite unsure what to do. They seem almost to have a conversation with their eyes that TJ cannot quite understand, and they both turn back to look at him. “Okay, well… we can talk about this later. You guys need to get ready for school. I’ll drive you.”

“You guys want some breakfast?” Bex asks, turning back to head into the kitchen. “I can try and make pancakes again.”

Andi groans loudly, normality seeping back into the house at once and trails after Bex. “Oh, please don’t. I don’t want to have to call the fire department again…”

Relief washes over TJ. He had worried for a moment that he was either about to meet his death or get banned from the Macks’ house forever. He isn’t sure what he’d do if he couldn’t go to Andi - he doesn’t want to go back to sleeping on a bench. Bowie steps over to him and he tries not to flinch as the man lays a gentle hand on his shoulder.

“I’m sorry I yelled,” he says, looking TJ directly in the eye. “It just took me by surprise is all… from now on just let us know when you’re coming over, yeah? You’re always welcome here, but we have to know you’re here.”

TJ nods and knows he’ll do as he’s told without question. “I promise.”

“Good man,” Bowie ruffles his hair and heads out towards the kitchen, leaving a stunned TJ in his wake.

Bex doesn’t quite burn down the kitchen with her pancakes, and they get TJ his own inflatable mattress to sleep on after that.

title: Three, Two, One
body:
[This is a tyrus oneshot based loosely on whatever information @joshua-rush has given us on 3x21]

Word count: 2190

“Andi, the streamers are amazing as they are. Relax for a bit,” shouted Bex to Andi, who was precariously standing on Cece’s railing, hanging up decorations for the New Year’s party that night.

“Says you!” Andi shouted back, demounting the railing. “Buffy, Cyrus, TJ, and Kira are coming at 10, and it’s already 9!”

“Wait,” Bex put down her magazine and looked at Andi, “Kira’s coming? I thought you guys hated her,”

“We haven’t invited her but I’m pretty sure she’ll end up coming along with TJ.”

“But I thought TJ liked Cyrus. He’s dating Kira now?”

“Mom, were you listening at all when I told you about the whole Costume Day mess?”

Bex paused for a moment, trying to muster up an excuse, “I guess, with all the wedding emotions it got lost in my brain. Sorry, kid.”

Andi’s face drooped. A wedding would’ve been nice (to say the least) after all their will-they, won’t-they drama. Something to cement it all. But, Bex and Bowie are still Bex and Bowie. Anyway, she had other things to think about. It was T-minus 54 minutes until the guests were to arrive and the house still wasn’t ready. Cece was out doing some last-minute donations she missed out on during Christmas, Andi was decorating the living room, and Bex was currently lifting herself off the couch to get more chips (for herself and the party) with Bowie.

***

T-minus 3 minutes and everything looked, as Andi said, “Just about ready,”

A playful knock came at the door. “It’s Buffy and Cyrus, I’ll get it!” Andi called to her family as she ran to the door.

“Hi, Alex, right?” said Kira, smiling, as she interlocked hands with a deadpanned TJ.

“Uh, it’s Andi, actually,” Andi’s eyebrows furrowed, “come in.”

Kira pranced into the house dragging TJ behind her. TJ could barely manage to get out a faint “Hey, Andi,” before Kira pulled him away and sat him on the couch.

“Can I get you guys anything? Chips and soda?” Andi asked, hesitantly.

“Chips would be great, thanks,” Andi started to walk to the kitchen with her hands stuck to her side, “oh, and Alex?” Andi turned around and sighed, “a diet coke for me and a sprite for TJ,”

“Actually, I’ll just have some water,” muttered TJ, as Kira shot him a glare.

“Got it,” Andi swiveled on her heel and left to the kitchen.

There was another knock at the door. “TJ, its probably Cyrus and Buffy,” Kira’s ears perked up at their names, “can you get it?” Andi called from the kitchen.

TJ began to push himself off the couch, but Kira pushed him back down, “I’ll get it,” said Kira, as she bounced to the door.

“Hey guys!” she greeted.

Buffy shoved past her pulling Cyrus along. Cyrus stopped when he saw TJ. “Buffy, he’s here. With Kira!” he whisper-shouted.

Buffy looked at the two in disgust before replying, “I’m confused, too,”

“He told me he was going to tell Kira to back off!”

Buffy shook her head and followed Cyrus into the kitchen. Neither dared to look at TJ.

“Andi, what is Kira doing here?” interrogated Buffy, her eyes wide,

“I don’t know, she just showed up with TJ. I couldn’t exactly make her leave,”

“Of course, you can. Follow me,” Buffy retorted as she marched into the living room, “Kira, can I talk to you outside?”

Kira frowned suspiciously at Buffy, following her out to the porch.

***

“What are you doing here?” Buffy started, “You’re not friends with any of us,”

“Where TJ goes, I go,” replied Kira.

“Was that TJ’s choice or was it just what you told him?”

“What does it matter?”

“TJ’s a nice guy, Kira. And he can make his own decisions. He doesn’t need some random girl with a terrible attitude to make them for him,”

“Did you just call TJ a ‘nice guy’? Wow, Buffy, you’ve gone soft,”

“Look, Kira, I’m trying to be reasonable but you’re testing my patience. Cyrus is an incredible person and whatever you said to TJ before Costume Day basically destroyed their friendship,”

“Friendship? Just friends? Because it seemed like more than that to me. Is that really what you want for Cyrus?”

The argument falls silent. Buffy’s mouth is slightly agape. “You need to leave. Right now,”

“Fine. But just so you know, TJ’s with me now. Not Cyrus, me,” Kira huffed before walking out of the compound, slamming the gate shut behind her.

***

“What do you think Buffy’s going to tell Kira?” asked Cyrus, intermittently peeking through the kitchen door to check on TJ.

“She’ll probably get rid of her somehow. I wouldn’t question it too much,” Andi trailed off when she noticed Cyrus’ gaze fixed on TJ, who was currently sitting on the couch fiddling with his phone case, “why don’t you go talk to him?” she questioned.

“And say what? We haven’t spoken since he apologised for the costume, and I don’t know how to talk to him after what he told Buffy and me,”

“About that, what happened? You guys never told me,”

“It isn’t really our story to tell. He’ll tell you when he’s ready. But since he said that, I figured he’d break up with Kira. He even told me he would, but I guess Kira’s still got him wrapped around her finger,”

“I’m sure he has a good reason. I didn’t like TJ for a long time, but I’ve seen the way he acts around you. Something lights up in him, Cy. He makes you happy, and I think you make him happy, too,”

“You really think so?”

“I do,”

Andi was interrupted by Buffy storming back into the house. She sat down next to TJ, silent.

“From the lack of blood on your clothes, I take it you didn’t kill Kira?” TJ remarked.

“I was close, but no. She did leave, though,”

TJ breathed a sigh of relief, prompting Buffy to urge him to talk to Cyrus, “I know you like him,” she gestured towards the kitchen, where Cyrus and Andi were still peering at the other boy, “you should talk to him,”

“You’re right, Driscoll. For once, I actually mean it,” TJ stood up halfway but sat back down, “But I have no idea what to say,”

“Just say ‘hi’ and see what happens. You two have never had trouble finding things to talk about before,”

“Yeah, turns out, we’re a lot alike,”

TJ nodded and stood up all the way. He took a deep breath and made his way to the kitchen. Andi smirked and speed walked into the living room to sit next to Buffy.

***

“Can I talk to you for a minute?” TJ asked, twiddling his thumbs, barely looking at Cyrus.

“I was actually just about to ask you the same thing,” Cyrus replied, “Let’s go to Andi Shack. It’s more private than—” he looked over at Buffy and Andi, who were staring intently at the two boys, “here,”

Cyrus led TJ to the backyard and into Andi Shack. “Isn’t Andi going to kill you for being here without her permission?” TJ asked as he fumbled in the dark for a light switch.

“Not necessarily,” TJ looked up in confusion, “It depends on how this conversation goes,”

“I see,”

After carefully moving pieces of art and art materials, the two sat down on a tattered bench covered in old paint.

“So, Kira, huh?” Cyrus started.

“I know what I said, Cy, but, it’s just—”

“Complicated, I got it,” he paused, “What you told me the other day, you were being serious?”

“Of course, I was. I’d never joke about that,”

Cyrus smiled at TJ, but TJ’s face was still full of worry.

“What is it?” asked Cyrus.

TJ stared at Cyrus blankly for a few moments, “I think you’re really great, Cyrus,” his eyes shifted down to the floor, “and I,” TJ gulped.

“TJ it’s okay, you don’t have to say anything you’re not ready to say. My parents say that’s almost as bad as bottling—”

“Can I kiss you at midnight?” TJ interrupted, causing Cyrus to go pale, his eyes wider than an owl’s.

“Can you—” Cyrus trailed off, unable to speak.

“Never mind, it was a dumb question. You probably don’t want to, anyway. I guess this conversation didn’t go as well as Andi had hoped and we’re probably dead meat,”

“Teej,” Cyrus called, as he noticed TJ getting up to leave, “you can,”

“I can?” TJ said, turning around to face Cyrus, subconscious smiles creeping onto their faces.

Cyrus simply nodded and stood up to hold the other boy’s hand, “It’s getting cold. We should go back inside,”

They switched off the light and went back into the house.

***

“Bex, Bowie! There’s less than an hour left, set the food out in the living room!” shouted Cece from the kitchen.

“Coming, I’m coming,” Bowie pulled her up off the couch and gently pushed her towards the kitchen, following not far behind.

“I think Cyrus and TJ made up,” Bex told Bowie, eyeing the boys as they entered the house.

“Why do you invest yourself in the lives of thirteen-year-olds, Rebecca?” questioned Cece, handing each one a tray stacked with sandwiches and cake.

“When were TJ and Cyrus fighting?” asked Bowie, walking out of the kitchen with his trays as well as Bex’s.

“I’m sure Andi will be glad to know I pay more attention to her rambling than her own father,” she replied, cheekily, taking the trays from Bowie and setting them down on the coffee table.

The kids immediately took notice of the food and stampeded towards the table. An assortment of compliments towards Cece’s were spoken by food-filled mouths.

***

With less than 2 minutes till the end of the year and a room full of satisfied stomachs and neighbourhood friendly music, the seven of them stood around the living room. Bowie and Bex were already standing in the corner, ready for midnight. Andi and Buffy were sitting on one side of the couch, somehow still eating the remaining chips, as they waited for the countdown. Cece was just trying not to fall asleep but gave in and went upstairs after reminding the kids (including Bex and Bowie) to clean up whatever mess they make. Cyrus was sitting next to Buffy, and TJ was sitting next to Cyrus.

The kids’ conversation was a long, muffled noise to the outside listener, but as the clock neared twelve, the chaos turned into a countdown.

“Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four,” Cyrus and TJ turned towards each other, barely three inches apart. The rest of the room faded to a big blur. It was just the two of them and there was no going back now.

“Three, two, one.”

As the rest cheered, “Happy New Year!” TJ had his hands gripped around Cyrus’ waist, and Cyrus’ hands were entangled in the other boy’s hair. Their eyes were closed tight, lips together, indifferent to the world.

The boys pulled away at the same time, when they realised the cheering had stopped. They opened their eyes to four people staring at them in disbelief.

“They really made up, huh?” added Bowie, breaking the silence. The rest chuckled as the new year began.

***

The next morning, the four kids went to The Spoon to meet up with Jonah.

“I apparently missed a lot,” Jonah stated, watching Cyrus and TJ walk in, hand in hand.

“Not much,” Cyrus chuckled and turned to TJ, who was trying to refrain from smiling.

“Baby taters?” Amber asked, approaching the table, “and happy new year, by the way!”

“Firstly, is that even a question, and secondly, you too, Ambs,” Andi blushed.

“So, that’s baby taters and,” her expression turned grim, “TJ, Kira came by earlier asking for—”

“Hey, Kippen, you got a second?” It was Kira. Again.

TJ stood up, “Anything you want to say to me, you can say in front of them,” Amber slowly backed away.

“Okay,” Kira looked around the table, “fine. I’m sorry. What I did to you was vindictive and, if I’m being honest, I mostly did it to get back at Buffy,” she mouths ‘sorry’ to Buffy, “It was wrong. I saw TJ and thought I had a chance but then Cyrus came along, and I figured, ‘why not?’”

“You still made two people feel badly about themselves just for being who they were,” retorted Buffy.

“Sometimes there’s a nice person trying to get out. I guess I still haven’t figured out how to do that. My parents told my neighbours what I told Buffy. I didn’t realise how much that would hurt someone. I’m sorry.” She walked out of the diner without a second glance.

“Well, at least she knows how to apologise unlike some of us,” Buffy joked.

“Hey!” TJ responded, “I can say—"

“Teej,” Cyrus gestured at his hands under the table. He put up three fingers, then two, then one, and gave TJ a quick kiss on the lips before changing the conversation, “So, Andi. Amber, huh?”

“Friendship? Just friends? Because it seemed like more than that to me. Is that really what you want for Cyrus?”

The argument falls silent. Buffy’s mouth is slightly agape. “You need to leave. Right now,”

“Fine. But just so you know, TJ’s with me now. Not Cyrus, me,” Kira huffed before walking out of the compound, slamming the gate shut behind her.

***

“What do you think Buffy’s going to tell Kira?” asked Cyrus, intermittently peeking through the kitchen door to check on TJ.

“She’ll probably get rid of her somehow. I wouldn’t question it too much,” Andi trailed off when she noticed Cyrus’ gaze fixed on TJ, who was currently sitting on the couch fiddling with his phone case, “why don’t you go talk to him?” she questioned.

“And say what? We haven’t spoken since he apologised for the costume, and I don’t know how to talk to him after what he told Buffy and me,”

“About that, what happened? You guys never told me,”

“It isn’t really our story to tell. He’ll tell you when he’s ready. But since he said that, I figured he’d break up with Kira. He even told me he would, but I guess Kira’s still got him wrapped around her finger,”

“I’m sure he has a good reason. I didn’t like TJ for a long time, but I’ve seen the way he acts around you. Something lights up in him, Cy. He makes you happy, and I think you make him happy, too,”

“You really think so?”

“I do,”

Andi was interrupted by Buffy storming back into the house. She sat down next to TJ, silent.

“From the lack of blood on your clothes, I take it you didn’t kill Kira?” TJ remarked.

“I was close, but no. She did leave, though,”

TJ breathed a sigh of relief, prompting Buffy to urge him to talk to Cyrus, “I know you like him,” she gestured towards the kitchen, where Cyrus and Andi were still peering at the other boy, “you should talk to him,”

“You’re right, Driscoll. For once, I actually mean it,” TJ stood up halfway but sat back down, “But I have no idea what to say,”

“Just say ‘hi’ and see what happens. You two have never had trouble finding things to talk about before,”

“Yeah, turns out, we’re a lot alike,”

TJ nodded and stood up all the way. He took a deep breath and made his way to the kitchen. Andi smirked and speed walked into the living room to sit next to Buffy.

***

“Can I talk to you for a minute?” TJ asked, twiddling his thumbs, barely looking at Cyrus.

“I was actually just about to ask you the same thing,” Cyrus replied, “Let’s go to Andi Shack. It’s more private than—” he looked over at Buffy and Andi, who were staring intently at the two boys, “here,”

Cyrus led TJ to the backyard and into Andi Shack. “Isn’t Andi going to kill you for being here without her permission?” TJ asked as he fumbled in the dark for a light switch.

“Not necessarily,” TJ looked up in confusion, “It depends on how this conversation goes,”

“I see,”

After carefully moving pieces of art and art materials, the two sat down on a tattered bench covered in old paint.

“So, Kira, huh?” Cyrus started.

“I know what I said, Cy, but, it’s just—”

“Complicated, I got it,” he paused, “What you told me the other day, you were being serious?”

“Of course, I was. I’d never joke about that,”

Cyrus smiled at TJ, but TJ’s face was still full of worry.

“What is it?” asked Cyrus.

TJ stared at Cyrus blankly for a few moments, “I think you’re really great, Cyrus,” his eyes shifted down to the floor, “and I,” TJ gulped.

“TJ it’s okay, you don’t have to say anything you’re not ready to say. My parents say that’s almost as bad as bottling—”

“Can I kiss you at midnight?” TJ interrupted, causing Cyrus to go pale, his eyes wider than an owl’s.

“Can you—” Cyrus trailed off, unable to speak.

“Never mind, it was a dumb question. You probably don’t want to, anyway. I guess this conversation didn’t go as well as Andi had hoped and we’re probably dead meat,”

“Teej,” Cyrus called, as he noticed TJ getting up to leave, “you can,”

“I can?” TJ said, turning around to face Cyrus, subconscious smiles creeping onto their faces.

Cyrus simply nodded and stood up to hold the other boy’s hand, “It’s getting cold. We should go back inside,”

They switched off the light and went back into the house.

***

“Bex, Bowie! There’s less than an hour left, set the food out in the living room!” shouted Cece from the kitchen.

“Coming, I’m coming,” Bowie pulled her up off the couch and gently pushed her towards the kitchen, following not far behind.

“I think Cyrus and TJ made up,” Bex told Bowie, eyeing the boys as they entered the house.

“Why do you invest yourself in the lives of thirteen-year-olds, Rebecca?” questioned Cece, handing each one a tray stacked with sandwiches and cake.

“When were TJ and Cyrus fighting?” asked Bowie, walking out of the kitchen with his trays as well as Bex’s.

“I’m sure Andi will be glad to know I pay more attention to her rambling than her own father,” she replied, cheekily, taking the trays from Bowie and setting them down on the coffee table.

The kids immediately took notice of the food and stampeded towards the table. An assortment of compliments towards Cece’s were spoken by food-filled mouths.

***

With less than 2 minutes till the end of the year and a room full of satisfied stomachs and neighbourhood friendly music, the seven of them stood around the living room. Bowie and Bex were already standing in the corner, ready for midnight. Andi and Buffy were sitting on one side of the couch, somehow still eating the remaining chips, as they waited for the countdown. Cece was just trying not to fall asleep but gave in and went upstairs after reminding the kids (including Bex and Bowie) to clean up whatever mess they make. Cyrus was sitting next to Buffy, and TJ was sitting next to Cyrus.

The kids’ conversation was a long, muffled noise to the outside listener, but as the clock neared twelve, the chaos turned into a countdown.

“Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four,” Cyrus and TJ turned towards each other, barely three inches apart. The rest of the room faded to a big blur. It was just the two of them and there was no going back now.

“Three, two, one.”

As the rest cheered, “Happy New Year!” TJ had his hands gripped around Cyrus’ waist, and Cyrus’ hands were entangled in the other boy’s hair. Their eyes were closed tight, lips together, indifferent to the world.

The boys pulled away at the same time, when they realised the cheering had stopped. They opened their eyes to four people staring at them in disbelief.

“They really made up, huh?” added Bowie, breaking the silence. The rest chuckled as the new year began.

***

The next morning, the four kids went to The Spoon to meet up with Jonah.

“I apparently missed a lot,” Jonah stated, watching Cyrus and TJ walk in, hand in hand.

“Not much,” Cyrus chuckled and turned to TJ, who was trying to refrain from smiling.

“Baby taters?” Amber asked, approaching the table, “and happy new year, by the way!”

“Firstly, is that even a question, and secondly, you too, Ambs,” Andi blushed.

“So, that’s baby taters and,” her expression turned grim, “TJ, Kira came by earlier asking for—”

“Hey, Kippen, you got a second?” It was Kira. Again.

TJ stood up, “Anything you want to say to me, you can say in front of them,” Amber slowly backed away.

“Okay,” Kira looked around the table, “fine. I’m sorry. What I did to you was vindictive and, if I’m being honest, I mostly did it to get back at Buffy,” she mouths ‘sorry’ to Buffy, “It was wrong. I saw TJ and thought I had a chance but then Cyrus came along, and I figured, ‘why not?’”

“You still made two people feel badly about themselves just for being who they were,” retorted Buffy.

“Sometimes there’s a nice person trying to get out. I guess I still haven’t figured out how to do that. My parents told my neighbours what I told Buffy. I didn’t realise how much that would hurt someone. I’m sorry.” She walked out of the diner without a second glance.

“Well, at least she knows how to apologise unlike some of us,” Buffy joked.

“Hey!” TJ responded, “I can say—"

“Teej,” Cyrus gestured at his hands under the table. He put up three fingers, then two, then one, and gave TJ a quick kiss on the lips before changing the conversation, “So, Andi. Amber, huh?”

“Can I kiss you at midnight?” TJ interrupted, causing Cyrus to go pale, his eyes wider than an owl’s.

“Can you—” Cyrus trailed off, unable to speak.

“Never mind, it was a dumb question. You probably don’t want to, anyway. I guess this conversation didn’t go as well as Andi had hoped and we’re probably dead meat,”

“Teej,” Cyrus called, as he noticed TJ getting up to leave, “you can,”

“I can?” TJ said, turning around to face Cyrus, subconscious smiles creeping onto their faces.

Cyrus simply nodded and stood up to hold the other boy’s hand, “It’s getting cold. We should go back inside,”

They switched off the light and went back into the house.

***

“Bex, Bowie! There’s less than an hour left, set the food out in the living room!” shouted Cece from the kitchen.

“Coming, I’m coming,” Bowie pulled her up off the couch and gently pushed her towards the kitchen, following not far behind.

“I think Cyrus and TJ made up,” Bex told Bowie, eyeing the boys as they entered the house.

“Why do you invest yourself in the lives of thirteen-year-olds, Rebecca?” questioned Cece, handing each one a tray stacked with sandwiches and cake.

“When were TJ and Cyrus fighting?” asked Bowie, walking out of the kitchen with his trays as well as Bex’s.

“I’m sure Andi will be glad to know I pay more attention to her rambling than her own father,” she replied, cheekily, taking the trays from Bowie and setting them down on the coffee table.

The kids immediately took notice of the food and stampeded towards the table. An assortment of compliments towards Cece’s were spoken by food-filled mouths.

***

With less than 2 minutes till the end of the year and a room full of satisfied stomachs and neighbourhood friendly music, the seven of them stood around the living room. Bowie and Bex were already standing in the corner, ready for midnight. Andi and Buffy were sitting on one side of the couch, somehow still eating the remaining chips, as they waited for the countdown. Cece was just trying not to fall asleep but gave in and went upstairs after reminding the kids (including Bex and Bowie) to clean up whatever mess they make. Cyrus was sitting next to Buffy, and TJ was sitting next to Cyrus.

The kids’ conversation was a long, muffled noise to the outside listener, but as the clock neared twelve, the chaos turned into a countdown.

“Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four,” Cyrus and TJ turned towards each other, barely three inches apart. The rest of the room faded to a big blur. It was just the two of them and there was no going back now.

“Three, two, one.”

As the rest cheered, “Happy New Year!” TJ had his hands gripped around Cyrus’ waist, and Cyrus’ hands were entangled in the other boy’s hair. Their eyes were closed tight, lips together, indifferent to the world.

The boys pulled away at the same time, when they realised the cheering had stopped. They opened their eyes to four people staring at them in disbelief.

“They really made up, huh?” added Bowie, breaking the silence. The rest chuckled as the new year began.

***

The next morning, the four kids went to The Spoon to meet up with Jonah.

“I apparently missed a lot,” Jonah stated, watching Cyrus and TJ walk in, hand in hand.

“Not much,” Cyrus chuckled and turned to TJ, who was trying to refrain from smiling.

“Baby taters?” Amber asked, approaching the table, “and happy new year, by the way!”

“Firstly, is that even a question, and secondly, you too, Ambs,” Andi blushed.

“So, that’s baby taters and,” her expression turned grim, “TJ, Kira came by earlier asking for—”

“Hey, Kippen, you got a second?” It was Kira. Again.

TJ stood up, “Anything you want to say to me, you can say in front of them,” Amber slowly backed away.

“Okay,” Kira looked around the table, “fine. I’m sorry. What I did to you was vindictive and, if I’m being honest, I mostly did it to get back at Buffy,” she mouths ‘sorry’ to Buffy, “It was wrong. I saw TJ and thought I had a chance but then Cyrus came along, and I figured, ‘why not?’”

“You still made two people feel badly about themselves just for being who they were,” retorted Buffy.

“Sometimes there’s a nice person trying to get out. I guess I still haven’t figured out how to do that. My parents told my neighbours what I told Buffy. I didn’t realise how much that would hurt someone. I’m sorry.” She walked out of the diner without a second glance.

“Well, at least she knows how to apologise unlike some of us,” Buffy joked.

“Hey!” TJ responded, “I can say—"

“Teej,” Cyrus gestured at his hands under the table. He put up three fingers, then two, then one, and gave TJ a quick kiss on the lips before changing the conversation, “So, Andi. Amber, huh?”
trail.content_abstract:
[This is a tyrus oneshot based loosely on whatever information @joshua-rush has given us on 3x21]

Word count: 2190

“Andi, the streamers are amazing as they are. Relax for a bit,” shouted Bex to Andi, who was precariously standing on Cece’s railing, hanging up decorations for the New Year’s party that night.

“Says you!” Andi shouted back, demounting the railing. “Buffy, Cyrus, TJ, and Kira are coming at 10, and it’s already 9!”

“Wait,” Bex put down her magazine and looked at Andi, “Kira’s coming? I thought you guys hated her,”

“We haven’t invited her but I’m pretty sure she’ll end up coming along with TJ.”

“But I thought TJ liked Cyrus. He’s dating Kira now?”

“Mom, were you listening at all when I told you about the whole Costume Day mess?”

Bex paused for a moment, trying to muster up an excuse, “I guess, with all the wedding emotions it got lost in my brain. Sorry, kid.”

Andi’s face drooped. A wedding would’ve been nice (to say the least) after all their will-they, won’t-they drama. Something to cement it all. But, Bex and Bowie are still Bex and Bowie. Anyway, she had other things to think about. It was T-minus 54 minutes until the guests were to arrive and the house still wasn’t ready. Cece was out doing some last-minute donations she missed out on during Christmas, Andi was decorating the living room, and Bex was currently lifting herself off the couch to get more chips (for herself and the party) with Bowie.

***

T-minus 3 minutes and everything looked, as Andi said, “Just about ready,”

A playful knock came at the door. “It’s Buffy and Cyrus, I’ll get it!” Andi called to her family as she ran to the door.

“Hi, Alex, right?” said Kira, smiling, as she interlocked hands with a deadpanned TJ.

“Uh, it’s Andi, actually,” Andi’s eyebrows furrowed, “come in.”
